oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Polymeric and cyclic manganese phosphates and phosphinates: Synthesis, spectral characterization and solid-state structures
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: POTHIRAJA, R

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Polymeric manganese phosphinates [Mn(ppi)(2)(bpy)](n) (1) and [Mn(ppi)(2)(phen)](n) (2) have been obtained by treating manganese acetate with phenylphosphinic acid (ppi- H) in the presence of either 2,2'-bpy or 1,10- phen, respectively. The reaction of preformed precursor [Mn(OAc)(bpy)(2)](ClO4)(H2O) with phosphinic acids or phosphate diesters yield [Mn(L)(bpy)(2)](2)(ClO4)(2) (where L- H = dtbp- H = di- tert- butyl hydrogen phosphate (3), dpp- H = diphenyl hydrogen phosphate (4), dppi- H = diphenyl phosphinic acid (5), and ppi-H = phenyl phosphinic acid (6)), which are dimeric compounds. Polymers 1- 2 and dinuclear cyclic compounds 3- 6 have been extensively characterized by analytical and spectroscopic methods and also in each case by a single crystal X- ray diffraction study.
